intro: Benzoin venosum, commonly known as the veiny benzoin, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, resinous sap. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lance-shaped leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are small and clustered, often greenish-yellow in color, and it produces a sticky, fragrant resin used in traditional medicine. The botanical features of benzoin venosum make it a valuable species in both ecological and pharmacological contexts.
